Class com.icl.saxon.ParserManager 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----com.icl.saxon.ParserManager
public class ParserManager
extends Object
ParserManager allows you to register a SAX-compliant XML parser as your default parser and use it whenever you run a SAXON application.

There is a command-line interface to register your preferred SAX parser, as follows:

java com.icl.saxon.ParserManager parser-class

There is also an interface which is used internally by SAXON, and which can be used by any SAX application, to discover the preferred parser and instantiate it.

ParserManager()

getParserClass()
main(String[])
Main program registers the default parser
Usage: java com.icl.saxon.ParserManager parser-class
makeParser()
Instantiate a SAX parser.
makeParser(String)
Create a new SAX parser object using the class name provided.
The named class must exist and must implement the org.xml.sax.Parser interface.
This method returns a parser but does not register it as the default parser.

ParserManager 
 public ParserManager()

makeParser 
 public static Parser makeParser()
Instantiate a SAX parser. The parser chosen is determined by reading a saxon.ini file which was previously set up by calling ParserManager from the command line.

getParserClass 
 public static String getParserClass()
makeParser 
 public static Parser makeParser(String className)
Create a new SAX parser object using the class name provided.
The named class must exist and must implement the org.xml.sax.Parser interface.
This method returns a parser but does not register it as the default parser.

Parameters:
className - A string containing the name of the SAX parser class, for example "com.microstar.sax.LarkDriver"
main 
 public static void main(String args[]) throws Exception
Main program registers the default parser
Usage: java com.icl.saxon.ParserManager parser-class
